721725f-a.text:
Morningside Park: A set of two views forming a panorama of the southerly portion of same which is bounded in these views by Cathedral Parkway (foreground, not seen), Manhattan Ave. (right) and Morningside DDrive (left). Forking off Manhattan Ave. at West 114th Street is Horningside Ave. to continue the easterly boundary of the Park. Atop the bluff at the left is the Cathedral of St. John (Protestant Episcopal) in a skeletal state. North of sar e are the 8 story structures of St. Luke's Hospital. The photographer's vantage point is the 110th Street station of the Ninth Ave. Elevated line and is vicwing northwestward.
March 1906.
George L. Balgue.
721725f-a.folder: Morningside Avenue & Cathedral Parkway, Manhattan, NY

721720f-a.text:
Nornineside Drive, west side, from Cathedral Parkway, (West 110th Street), to and including 113th Street. At the right of the picture is the Protestant Episcopal Cathedral of St. John the Devine, (A rear view). TWis view also ahows Cnthedral Parkway (110th Street), north nide, from and including Norninaside Drive, to and including Amsterdam
Ave.
1926.
Provn Brothers.

718117f-c.folder: Cathedral Parkway & Manhattan Avenue, Manhattan, NY

718118f-b.text:
Cathedral Parkway (W. 110th Srreet) at Manhattan Avenue, showing details of the 9th Avenue 'El" system and its station at this point. The photographer's general direction is westward. The tracks curve southward at Columbus Avenue, and tha Parkway continues uphill towards Amsterdam Avenue and Broadway. Morningside Park is on the right with the Protestant Cathedral of St. John just beyond. Note the glimpse of St. Lukes Hospital over the station shedroof.
June 6, 1940
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
718118f-b.folder: Cathedral Parkway & Manhattan Avenue, Manhattan, NY

721600f-a.text:
Manhattan Avenue, south from West 110th Street, showing pavement conditions during the W. P. A. repair period.
June 4, 1937
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project

721719f-a.text:
Morningside Drive, between Cathedral Parkway and 113th Street, view northwest from; the Ninth Avenue Elevated station. This shows the choir school, the old part of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, with the new nave under construction, and St. Luke's
Hospital on the northern side of 112th Street.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
